dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARVEY SHINE, mid-60's, sits at a piano in a scruffy recording room, tinkering. We hold on his slightly sad, intense gaze. Just then a shaft of crude light illuminate him, accompanied by a knocking sound. From behind a studi window, JOHNNIE, a young rocker type in his 20's beckons. Harvey closes the piano lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie, unpacking his lunch and turning on various butto sits at a mixing desk. In front of him are 2 large TV monitors. Harvey joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put my score up first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't want to hear it, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I want to hear it. Put it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm backed up already, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Johnnie, you were the one that was late. Just put it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie reluctantly presses various buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A `cheesy' commercial for a washing detergent plays. It i accompanied by a jolly classical score. Harvey looks on forlornly at his work. As it comes to an end with a flour Harvey lowers his head. Beat. Johnnie glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Harvey. Marvin wants me to present my ideas while your away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks up, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not doing myself any favours here, Harvey. But, I'd watch your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Harvey's tired, pensive face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hurriedly exits the studio, catching up with a man walking to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin? Hey, Marvin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harvey. Shouldn't you be in London?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm heading there now. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie said something about you wanting him to present on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, No, I was just thinking that, what with you being in London - you should stay a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need to rush back. Enjoy your daughter's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Johnnie can do it. I mean, he can pitch the Samuelson account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm coming back. Those are my connections. They have been for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but... they've got new people running things over there. I think they're after something... (beat) ...different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to come back. I should be there in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `There in person'? Harvey, nobody cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to stand behind my music!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're demos! - They're already pressed. No one needs to be there. They're not looking for you, they're not looking for me. They just need a fucking track. (beat/sighs) Harvey, you haven't booked a top line in 8 months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me doing triangle chimes for Christ's sake - give me something to compose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm trying to tell you! It's not about composition! It's different now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Harvey looks at Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm back on Monday, Marvin. I'm coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) You got to land this one, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying? (beat) Say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying there are no more chances, Harvey. (beat) Enjoy London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that Marvin gets in and drives   off, leaving Ha standing alone in the car park. We hold   on his face - h tired. He looks about him, then down at   his raincoat dr over his arm. He lifts it and drapes it   over the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound of interior airborne plane. The seat-belt `ping' chimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, seated in a crowded economy cabin, looks down fro the now extinguished seat-belt light. He looks a little h Reaching up to turn on the air, he knocks his tray - knoc his drink into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An attractive middle-aged woman, seated next to him, look over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a passing Stewardess) Miss? I'm sorry. I've spilt my drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you some napkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his neighbour) Why's it always me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman, perhaps wary of the length of the flight, smil noncommittally. The Stewardess returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I take that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... And could I get another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whiskey, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. `Jamesons', no ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stewardess heads off. Harvey mops himself up. He plac the small mass of wet towels on his tray and sighs. Glanc out the window, he then turns to the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A holiday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling obliged) Yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter's getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Thank you. (beat) She's marrying an American. But for some reason we've all got to go over to London. (smiling) I told her we had a perfectly good wedding system here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat/expecting more of a response) They both work there, you see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman smiles again, then looks up as the Stewardess returns with Harvey's drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey is about to continue speaking when the woman interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry but I have a meeting in the morning and I must try and get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Of course. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just, I'll be useless - unless I get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman covers herself in a blanket and turns out her light, turning herself away from Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Harvey from a distance, spotlit in a sea of darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound of a commercial London Radio Station. A `phone-in' competition takes place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A radio hangs from a mail trolley. KATE, mid 40's, dresse a green uniform, turns into the path of a suburban house. passes a postman - who nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning Kate. Looking lovely as ever. If I was younger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful Paddy. (pointing to her cheek) Blushing! Is she up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles before unlocking the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate comes through the door, picking up a small pile of m off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Mum. It's me - your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate puts the mail on a kitchen table. Just then MAGGIE, Kate's mum, enters in her dressing gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a cup of tea with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I'm running late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie seems to ignore this piece of information and head the kettle. Filling it up, she peers out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking through her bag) Who? At what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbour. Barbecuing or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see her POV of her neighbour busying himself in his ba garden. Smoke rises from a small garden shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard he's from Poland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling a small package from her bag) So maybe Polish people like to barbecue a lot. I'm leaving your prescription on the table. (beat) You know, you don't have to keep taking these - the Doctor said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to. It makes me feel better. (beat) Its 8 o'clock in the morning. Who barbecues at 8?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her watch) I've got to go. I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's mum sighs and turns away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Don't worry about me. I'll be Ok. (beat) Have you got that date thing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, maybe. (kisses her mother) Bye Mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Time and tide', Kate, as your father liked to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that from his terrace in the South of France?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate winces. Kate's mum looks hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That was mean. (beat/takes a breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'll call you later. (kisses her mum again) I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kate leaves, Maggie watches her go. She sighs, before returning her attention back to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV: The Neighbour enters his smoking shed and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy High St. Kate moves amongst the throng boarding a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up on Kate's face gently swaying. She stands readin paperback, oblivious to the crowded bus around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits reading on a speeding train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Heathrow Express comes into the station. Kate disemba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate arrives at a booth. A sign reads: `PSA - Public Statistics Agency'. A West Indian woman, dressed in the s green uniform, stands waiting. She holds a newspaper, fol open at the crossword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate goes behind the counter and turns on a light. As the booth illuminates, Kate unlocks a door behind and goes in Without looking up from her crossword, Aggie follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate places her bag in a locker and takes out a pair of heels. Sitting down to put them on, Aggie enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four across. A filmy layer on the surface of a liquid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate thinks for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggie giggles to herself and writes it in. Kate stands ju as another co-worker hurries in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses Kate on the cheek and opens her locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God you're my boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking up, Aggie `tuts' and shakes her head. Oon decides to ignore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we still on for tonight? Matt's definitely bringing Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you guys swear you won't leave if it's not going well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven down. Another word for `souvenir'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate thinks for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Memento.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggie laughs and scribbles it in. Oonagh rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggie, why do you bother? You just get Kate to give you all the answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggie `tuts' again and waves Oonagh away. Kate hands Oona clip-board and the two of them head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As luggage spews out, a dishevelled Harvey looks on. He s his case and awkwardly pulling it from the belt, heads of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oonagh and Kate stand next to each other, interviewing returning travellers. Kate interviews an elderly couple. clear she's good at her job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you spent the whole 2 weeks in the Toronto area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Our daughter lives there, see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. (filling in a form) So not a business trip then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Unless you count grand- children as work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Some might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey comes through a set of sliding double doors, wheel his case behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate finishes up the interview with the elderly couple, a turns to see an approaching Harvey in the distance. She registers his attempts to steer a wide berth of her, but matches his movements, bringing him to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I couldn't just ask you a few very quick questions, could I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I'm in a bit of a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't take a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to walk on) Look, I'm sorry, but I'm tired, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Kate's directness, brings Harvey to a stop. He turn look at Kate. She smiles. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey continues on, glancing back once more as he walks away. Kate turns to Oonagh and shrugs, before returning h attention back to the sea of arrivals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Taxi pulls away from the Terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey sits in the back with his phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Suzie, it's your Dad. I've made it in one piece. I'm in a Taxi on my way to the Hotel. I guess i'll see you all there. Can't wait. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hangs up. He dials another number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, it's Harvey, Harvey Shine here. Just wanted to confirm Mike for Monday. I'm in London at the moment, but reachable on my cell. Which is... Well you've probably got it on file, but just in case, 917... Well you may have to dial an international code first, I'm not sure. Anyway, it's 917 749 7558. That's 917 74...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sharp `beep' cuts him off. Harvey hangs up and looks ou the window. Cranes loom on the horizon. He yawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Taxi pulls into the forecourt of a mid-market West En London Hotel. Harvey gets out and pays the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey approaches the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm with the wedding party. There should be a room for me. Harvey Shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Concierge taps into his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I have a double room for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Has everyone else checked in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter. Susan Shine. Or maybe she's already going by Wright. Susan Wright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Concierge taps some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. No one of that name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a Mrs Pearce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More tapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Concierge looks at Harvey. Beat. Harvey shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey enters the room. He places his case on the bed, ta off his jacket and goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A roller blind is pulled down. Harvey tugs on the cord, t avail at first. Then suddenly it whips up, causing Harvey duck backwards as the flailing cord almost takes his eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warily, Harvey steps forward and looks down at the busy street below. He goes to open the window but it is stuck. tries again - but it won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around the room, then up at the now fully contra blind. Tentatively he reaches up and pulls the cord to lo the blind a little. It slowly starts to unravel and unravel...and unravel, until it hits the bottom of the wi sill with a gentle thud. Harvey stands in semi-darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, to his relief, his phone rings. He hurries ove the bed and retrieves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (beat) Suzie! Hi darling. Yes, I'm here. Where are you - where is everyone? (listens/Harvey's face drops a little) Oh...I see. No, I didn't realise. I thought the plan was for everyone to stay together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noticeably dejected, Harvey sits down on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No its...fine. I just wasn't sure. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So your mother has rented a house for you all. (beat) I see. No, no, don't be silly. I'm a big boy. It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks around the bland room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home from home. (beat) Yes, I've got the address. So, I'll see you there. (beat) I love you too. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, dressed for the evening, hurries along a street. He phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's mum stands not far from her back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you wearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dungarees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're completely in again, haven't you heard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting back the curtain) Oh, you're just being silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV: A now bare chested Neighbour at work in his garden. Smoke rising from his shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't be nervous. Just be yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Ok, mum. Thanks for the advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, listen. I've been thinking about Greece for our holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns) Ok, Let's talk about it later. (beat) I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate hangs up and crosses a busy road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's mum continues to spy. POV: The Neighbour bends dow out of sight. On rising again, he sees Maggie at the wind and waves. Maggie flinches, before dropping the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate comes through the door. Oonagh sits on her own at a booth. Kate joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry i'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me... (makes the gesture of a telephone) ...your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's worrying about her new neighbour. Says he barbecues a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you the same as me. (off Kate's gaze) They're at the bar. He seems very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then two guys approach from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt embraces Kate, then turns to his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, this is Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon shakes Kate's hand. Kate blushes ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (beat) You work with Matt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. If you can call it work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs a little too eagerly) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, i'm feeling small down here. Sit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up of Harvey's face under shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey puts on a cream linen jacket, that matches a pair slacks. He looks at himself in a full length mirror. He l good. There is a knock at the door, just as his phone rin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey opens the door, as he answers his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just over by the bed. Thank you. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young African man wheels in a trolley with a pot of tea some biscuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I open this for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads towards the window. Harvey turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. The blind wips up - toggle hitting the young ma the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The porter, covering his eye, nods, backing towards the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Yes, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey wedges a fiver into his free hand as he retreats rapidly. The door closes. Beat. Harvey returns the phone his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. He sits down on the bed and pours some tea. Ju then his phone rings again. He reaches for it, knocking t trolley and the tea onto himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing a tea towel, he dabs his trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance, across a crowded Friday night bar, we wa our gang chat. It seems to be going well. Laughter hangs the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab pulls up in front of a posh looking restaurant. Har steps out, dressed in the same cream jacket, but now spor a pair of dark trousers. He looks like a bad lounge act. cab pulls away as Harvey turns towards the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey enters. Three young men stand to one side, chattin animatedly. On seeing Harvey, one of them looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott turns to his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Susan's father, Harvey. Harvey Shine. (beat) Harvey, this is my best man, Josh Stillman and Pete Turner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you Harvey? (glancing at Harvey's attire) Its great to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thanks. Great. (sensing his gaze) How are you holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (turning to his friends) Can't wait to marry your daughter, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... (beat) Is she..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's through there. She'll be thrilled you're here. I'll go and find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Harvey's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey turns away and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (listens) No, no, that's not right. I booked Mike. It's important. I spoke to him about it two weeks ago. I booked him. (getting flustered) Have you told him its Harvey. It's really important... (suddenly conscious of Scott's friends standing nearby) Just...Just get him to call me, Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hangs up. And putting on his `positive' face turns back to Scott's friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (beat) Always something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (beat) What's your field, Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm a... (beat) I work in the music industry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a composer. (beat) Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. What kind of stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, for...commercials, that sort of thing. TV. (beat) Mostly background stuff, that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slightly awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds profitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can be. (wanting to change subject) You guys work with Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oil, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Futures, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure that's pretty profitable too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys smile a little too readily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey tries to smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd better find my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Good to meet you, Harvey. See you in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harvey moves off into the adjacent room, the guys watc him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Oonagh wait in line for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice? Nice like good. Or nice like dull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice like how old is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oonagh smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old enough. Your age...ish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't be, he's looks like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, my age. But Matt says he's very mature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right. Did Matt offer that up - or was that in response to you two discussing my approaching barrenness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Kate's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to. She's on her own. (beat) She gets lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell her you're busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods and indicates that the loo is free. Oonagh goes as Kate answers her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey enters the room. He sees his daughter, standing of one side, with Scott, talking to some friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks beautiful. He takes a moment to just watch her. she turns in slight slow motion, she smiles on seeing her father and joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suz... (beat) You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slightly awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a hug then, as they say in this country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace. Beat. Off Susan's look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I look ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a bad lounge act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan smiles at her Father. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spilt something on my trousers. (beat) I've been doing that a lot recently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks over at Scott in the distance, sharing a lau with his buddies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long way to come to see two American kids get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan looks at her father, a little irked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for the inconvenience, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks at his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen mum yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They're over by our table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (beat) I'll be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, they are approached by Scott guiding some frie over to say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who i've got!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan's girlfriends shriek with delight as they approach. Susan turns to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll speak to you later Suz. You enjoy your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Susan greets her friends, Harvey retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate rejoins the others. Oonagh and Matt are standing. Ma has his jacket on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) We've gotta go. Problem at home. Baby-sitter just rang. Nothing serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) But you guys stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate makes eyes at Oonagh, who shrugs innocently. Oonagh to kiss Kate, while Matt says goodbye to Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath) Enjoy yourself - you miserable cow. And turn off that phone. (beat) Are you working tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Half-day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oonagh kisses Kate and heads off with Matt, leaving Kate standing slightly awkwardly next to a seated Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we've been set up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not your fault. I mean, I'm fine with it. I mean, I'm happy to meet new people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're Oonagh's boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) Sorry, I'm saying `yes' a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (smiles) You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want another drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye... (smiles) Sure. I can get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. What do you fancy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have another white wine. Anything dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon heads off to the bar. Kate watches him go. She allo herself a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey stands at the bar and downs a whiskey. Picking up another glass, he turns away, and with drink in hand, approaches a group of people standing around a table. As nears, a distinguished older man with a healthy main of w hair sees him and momentarily touches the arm of the woma standing next to him. She turns around to see Harvey approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey turns his gaze to the white haired man and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey. Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a palpable sense of tension in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deliberately only directed to Jean) So our baby girl is really getting married. Who would've thought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey you remember the Watsons. Barry and Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey turns to a couple, standing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slight sarcastic tone) Of course I do. Hell, its been a while. I guess, not since Jean and I split up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Harvey. You look well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jill. You're looking well too. Both of you. I guess you guys stayed in touch with Jean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry and I work together now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding? Insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) Property, now. A small portfolio down in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real Estate. That's great. (beat) That's really great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I think we should sit. I know Susan wanted us all seated before they joined us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone begins to take their assigned seats. Harvey is o the inside close to the middle. It's a bit tight and invo people getting up to make way. Harvey gets to his seat an just about to sit when his phone rings. Brian and Jean sh a look. Taking it out of his pocket Harvey looks at the incoming number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I have to take this. (picks up) Can you hold a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey makes his way back along the table, causing people stand again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey walks away from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits waiting. Simon has finally been served and turn from the bar with drinks in hand. As he does a young woma standing with a small party of two other girls and a guy, greets him. Kate looks on. It's obvious from Simon's reac that they know each other well. Just then Kate's phone ri again. She looks at the number and thinks about ignoring but in the end, reluctantly picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum. You've got to stop calling. (beat) What? I can't hear. Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gets up and moves towards the back-room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey stands on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting more and more flustered) It'll take two hours max. No longer. (listens) Have you told him its Harvey? Look, we go back! He'll tell you. Just have him call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey returns to the table. Everyone is seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices his name place has been moved to the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling/to Jean) Did you move me darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Harvey. I didn't touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. I moved you. I thought it might be easier in case you needed to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey takes the last remaining seat. Brian stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we have a quick toast to get things going? (beat) I'm going to save my big speech for tomorrow. (laughter) Dear Susan and Dear Scott, I just want to take us all back to that wonderful holiday we all had in Rome together last year and wish you `Salute'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean and I love you both so much. And we're so happy that Scott is going to part of our clan now. And so I say many, many, happy, happy years ahead. Salute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My turn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to Harvey as he stands to make a speech. J then his phone rings on vibrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey scrambles to turn it off, as Jean rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I thought it was off. (flustered he finally manages to stop it buzzing) Um, uh. (beat) To Susan and Scott. A great couple. (beat) Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momentary awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone tucks in. Harvey sits slightly blushing at the e of the table, knowing he's blown it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate hangs up and returns to the main room, to find that Simon has been joined at their table by the young group. bolsters herself before returning to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Kate. (beat) Sorry, i bumped into these guys and couldn't shake them. (turning to his friends) Everyone this is Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate holds up her hand, before blushing a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate this is Andrew, Melissa, Gwen, and Elinor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I hope we're not barging in on your evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Simon's idea. How do you guys know each other, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate glances at Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't really. We just met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa looks at Simon and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blind date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) We met through friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. I think we should leave you guys alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little too abruptly) No. (beat) Don't. Stay. It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slightly awkward pause, broken by Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey does anyone know the cricket score?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: England were all out by tea, when I last checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cricket. Don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Men in white. Oh, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks on as the girls laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey sits at the end of the table, looking on, as every talks animatedly around him. He eats his food and drinks plenty of wine. Up near the middle Scott shares a joke wi Brian. Just then Susan, who has been talking to the best turns and catches her father's eye. He smiles at her and raises a glass. Susan smiles back before returning her attention back to her neighbour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits among the group. She too seems to be detached f the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that they did it in her bedroom, while she was away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was her flat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. He has his own, but was basically living at hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the conversation continues in this vein, Kate glances Simon. He seems more at ease in this company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meal is drawing to a close. People have gotten up and circulating around the table and nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey stands at the bar. He downs a drink. Jean approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Jean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to barman) Can I get a glass of water please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barman obliges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Downing another drink) Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go easy Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting quite loaded) Why, Jean? Are you worried i'm going to embarrass you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Harvey, I'm worried you're going to embarrass yourself. (beat) And more importantly Susan. This weekend's just about her and Scott. Nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're good Jean. You're really good. You've always known how to make me feel shit, haven't you? (beat) You've always been so good at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had cause to practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Jean. Were you ever proud of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Sometimes. (beat) But you never listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parties Jean. The fuckin' parties, where I would hear you - dressing up what I did for a living - film composer this, film composer that - trying to make it more palatable for your friends. I'm a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Don't Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you see in Brian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean looks into Harvey's eyes. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't talk about himself. (beat) He talks about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey stares back, momentarily transfixed, before turnin away dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home Harvey. Go to bed and see your daughter get married tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean walks away. Harvey stands at the bar. Susan comes in the room. She approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Suz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upbeat) Yeah. I'm great. How are you doing? Enjoying yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems a good guy, Scott. You'll be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he is. (beat) I'm sorry, I haven't had much time to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sweetheart, it's your weekend. It's no problem. You just enjoy yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (beat) Well, not great, but...fine. You know the usual. Triangle chimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still doing your own stuff? You should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit... Not so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Harvey looks away, then back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Suz, I'm really sorry about having to leave early. It's just bad timing. There's a sudden rush at work, you know, a couple of big jobs in at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just can't be helped. But I'll be there at the ceremony, at the really important bit. I'll be there to give you away. (beat) And then I'm sure Brian or your mother will talk at the reception. You know me, I've never been very good at speech...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Suz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I've been thinking. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian has been a really big part of my life now for some time. And... (long beat) And I'm going to ask him to give me away tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colour drains from Harvey's ruddy face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Suz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I've hardly seen you in the past five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, it is. Maybe a quick coffee here, or a telephone call there but no, you haven't been part of my life. And... (beat) And Brian has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You having to leave early this weekend. I don't know, it just seems typical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flash of irritation) It's work darling. It pays for things. (beat/sighs) Sorry. Look, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I'm sorry Dad, but it's what I've decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey momentarily turns away from his daughter, to compo himself, before turning back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (beat) I understand, Suz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey leans in and kisses his daughter on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go and be with your friends. Go and enjoy yourself. (pulls out his phone) I gotta make some stupid calls. You know. Go and enjoy yourself, Sweetheart. I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan reluctantly walks away as Harvey lifts the phone to ear. We hold on his face. With Susan gone he lowers the phone. He looks frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey enters the rest-room and heads to a bank of basins turns on a tap and bends down - drinking profusely. He splashes his face then rises and begins to dry it with so paper towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey suddenly bends over as though he'd been punched ha in the stomach. He rises, red in the face, holding his no desperately trying to hold it in. But he can't - Harvey s huge heaving muffled cries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, someone enters. Head down, Harvey lunges for t door and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey stumbles out of the restaurant and into a waiting The cab pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits surrounded by laughter. Simon's attention is fi fixed on his friends. Kate's humiliation is magnified as slowly move into her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gets up and walks away. Everyone momentarily stops chatting and looks to Simon, who shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate enters a cubicle. She sits down to have a pee. We ho on her sad face. She suddenly grimaces, before holding fi But not before a tear has been expelled and rolls down he cheek. She swats it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Harvey's sad face as it gently bobs in the bac a moving cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate exits the pub, just as a cab pulls up. As Harvey exi one side, Kate gets into the other, as the cab pulls away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bride and Groom stand at the head of the room, saying the vows. Harvey stands near the back, looking on. As the ceremony is concluded the audience spontaneously burst in applause. Harvey looks around the room, then back at his daughter, as she smiles giddily at her husband. Harvey sl out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying his case, Harvey hails a Taxi and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, back in green, stands next to a young couple asking them questions about their travel arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Taxi comes to a stop in `classic' mid-day London traf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey glances at his watch, then out at the mass of cars front of them. His phone rings. He picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead. Harvey puts his phone away. He glance out the window again as the Taxi crawls forward, before a coming to a stop. Harvey leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there another way we could try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, looking a little irked, glances at Harvey in mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be bad everywhere. Your president's in town. It's causing chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey rubs his neck and glances again at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate eats a snack, while reading a book. Her phone sudden rings. She sighs quietly before slowly picking it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Taxi pulls up. Harvey gets out, pays the driver and hur into the Terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counter is mobbed. A long queue snakes away from it. Harvey hurries to the front, where a male Steward is attending to another passenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but, I'm on the 4.30 to JFK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey pal, we're all in hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hand luggage, can i go straight to the gate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm dealing with a passenger, you'll have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I've gotta make that flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, everyone is in a hurry. You'll just have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey sees another Steward momentarily free, and turns t her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss, i'm on the 4.30 to JFK. Can you check me in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that flight's now closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not yet 4! I just have hand luggage. It doesn't take off for another 40 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry sir, but we have to close the gate 45 minutes prior to departure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just have hand luggage. Please. I've got to get on that flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry sir, there's nothing I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the next flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one at 8.30. But I     know that's full. I can put you     on stand- by, but I doubt you'll get     on. (beat) The earliest I can get you     on for sure, is tomorrow morning,     10.30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People look over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm sorry, but you have to stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey sits holding his phone. He dials a number, lifting phone to his ear. He gets voice-mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin. It's Harvey. Listen, there's been a mess up, the traffic was crazy. I'm going to have to reschedule the pitch slightly. Frank can set up. I'll email him the cue numbers - he knows what to do. And then I'll be there lunch- time at the latest. I'll come straight from the airport. I'll try you again shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hangs up and stares at the phone. Beat. He looks u and around the Terminal. A young child has a tantrum near Suddenly his phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic was insane. But listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) The traffic, Harvey? Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Marvin sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Harvey. Stay in London. Enjoy your daughter's wedding. We'll talk when you get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine, I'll be there lunch- time. It's no problem. Steve knows what I need. Mike's coming in. It's all set u...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Harvey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. (beat/sighs) It's out of my hands Harvey. I have people to answer to. We just can't afford the space. (beat) We're letting you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letting me go? Can't afford the space? Marvin, I'll be there lunch- time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Harvey. (beat/sighs) Call me when you get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead. Harvey closes his phone. Beat. He sta ahead into space, then stands and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate closes up the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits at a table near the bar, drinking a glass of wi and reading her book. She glances up as a man enters. Har takes a seat at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamesons, no ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barman serves Harvey. Harvey immediately downs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another. (beat) Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barman refills his glass. Again Harvey knocks it back Kate glances up from her book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barman glances at Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey reaches for the now full glass. But knocks it, spilling it into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks up again, along with the few other patrons in bar. Harvey registers their gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Vulgar American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles, before returning to her book. Harvey dabs hi trousers with some napkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I know, we don't raise our voices in this country. It's not done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey puts the sodden napkins down onto the bar. He look himself in the mirror behind the bar and rubs his chest. sighs and glances around the room. He sees Kate and recognizes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks up. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For yesterday. I was rude. You tried to ask me some questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just trying to do your job and I was rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really remember, but I'm sure you were. Most people are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate returns to her book. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It probably would be, if i could finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up his hands) I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Harvey downs another shot. Kate looks up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks over) Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, that'll help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, it will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reckon it'll help as much as that trashy novel and a glass of chardonnay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O-kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey winces, lowering his head into his hand. Putting s money onto the bar, he turns and joins Kate, taking a sea an adjacent table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry. That was out of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up) What? Go away and stop apologizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that i've had a really shitty day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back at her book) Join the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean really shitty. Yours may have been shitty, but mine was shittier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Finally, Kate looks up again at this strange man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How shitty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed my flight. I lost my job. And my daughter who got married in London today asked her step father rather than me to give her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Harvey sympathetically for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. (beat) But what can I do for you? (beat) Make it worse, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me make it up to you. (beat) Would you let me buy you lunch. What time is it - tea time? I'll buy you tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate blushes ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very sweet of you, but... I don't know you. And... you don't know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. That's why we should have lunch - tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate can't help but smile. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, but...no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates her book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you've got your book. And it's a good replacement for humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles and nods. Just then her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's for me I'm in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles as she takes out her phone and looks at the incoming number. She is about to answer, when she stops herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to answer that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks for a moment, before putting the phone back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I take that as a hopeful sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is, you could just give me a little wider smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate can't help but smile wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's mum pulls the phone away from her ear, perplexed b the lack of response. Her eyes wander to the window. Draw back the curtain, she looks out. POV: The Neighbour, now sporting a white apron, busies himself as usual. He sudde bends down and heaves what would best be described as a b bag onto his shoulder. As he stumbles under the weight, h carries it into the shed. Kate's mum turns away ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate remain seated at adjacent tables. Muzak p in the background. They are now virtually the sole patron Chez Gerard. Kate eats a salad and reads her book. Just t Harvey's food arrives. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look we are having lunch together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up and smiles) No. We're having lunch next to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. (beat/suddenly holds out his hand) I'm Harvey. Harvey Shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes it) Kate. Kate Walker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate can't help but smile at Harvey's persistence. Beat. puts down her book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why aren't you at the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, momentarily taken aback by the directness of Kate question, is about to answer, when the sound of a vacuum cleaner erupts. Harvey and Kate look over to see a cleane vacuuming the floor nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that's better. I knew something was missing. (shouting over the din) I had to get back for a work thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the din) A work thing. For the job you just lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over din) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over din) I see. (beat) So, this job you lost. You liked it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over din) Yes. (beat) No. Not really. They've beaten it out of me. But its what i do - did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over din) Which is - was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) I'm a composer. (stops himself) I write jingles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vacuuming stops. They both look over, then back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's about the normal response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I would of heard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Uh...Uh... (long beat) Well, maybe, I mean it maybe before your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) No, go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey smiles a little sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singsong voice) You can take the Salem out of the country - but you can't take the country out of Salem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vacuuming starts up again. They look over then back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over din) Did you always want to write jingles or was there something more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just love the way you...you just cut through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that as a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should. (beat) I was going to be a Jazz pianist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can be nosey. I tend to blurt stuff out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking from his reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I like it. I like it... (beat/over din) ...Alot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vacuuming stops. Beat. Kate looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a relief to find someone in this country who actually says what they feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, haven't you heard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all changed. We're a nation changed. Ever since Diana, we've unlocked ourselves. Everything's flowing out. (beat) You guys showed us the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as we're trying to adopt your stiff upper lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is a stiff upper lip, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey tries to physicalize it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think, it's more this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stretches her top lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. (copies her) How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (top lip stretched) Yeah you're getting there. Stretch it out further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, now you're doing a bulldog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, now you look like you don't have any teeth. (beat) Are they your own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad had a front one that you could just take out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they sit there, lips stretched, nattering away, we sta to pull back. Accompanied by a simple piano score we look as they appear to us, momentarily, like an ordinary coupl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate exit the restaurant. They stand opposite other in the quietening Terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I...enjoyed myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. So did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slightly awkward pause. Kate glances at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get going. I have a class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit sheepish) Yes. A...writing class. (beat) Twice a week. Just something I do. (changing the subject)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take the Heathrow Express. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hadn't really thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess I'll stay in a Hotel near here. My flight's in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...it's been a pleasure...Harvey Shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes it has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands, smiling. Just then Kate's phone rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your phone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) Sorry. I'd better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns and leaves. Harvey watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey picks up a hotel phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like a room please. (beat) One night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate waits on the platform as a train glides into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stands in a crowded middle section. A mild commotion ensues down the other end of the carriage as somebody squeezes aboard at the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks up to see Harvey making his way down the crowd carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People reluctantly make way for Harvey and his case. He finally arrives next to Kate as the train jolts forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momentarily losing his balance, Harvey steadies himself o businessman's shoulder. Kate leans forward to help, as th businessman turns slightly irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (turning to Kate) Hi. (a little sheepish) I thought i might as well stay in town. More fun than a hotel next to a runway, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods. Harvey smiles a little sheepishly as the train speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train speeds past on its way into London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate stand next to each other, gently swaying, the crowded carriage. The businessman standing next to Harvey, talks loudly on his phone about his day's conques Harvey and Kate share a look. In a Keatonesque performanc Harvey, keeping his body rigid, slowly leans further and further away from the man, making Kate smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train pulls into the station. We watch as Harvey and alight with the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to a stop outside. It's still light. A beautifu fall afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi's are over there. They'll take you to wherever you need to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks towards the Taxi rank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess it's goodbye again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (looks up at the evening sky/beat) So, I couldn't walk you to your class, could I? (beat) Carry your books? (beat) Stand near the curb so you don't get splashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage: Accompanied by a wonderfully romantic little dit we watch from a distance as Harvey and Kate navigate the buzzing streets of central London. All is alive and well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey drops his suitcase off at the same hotel he was staying in before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they wander through the city, foreign students mingle, policemen chat, and office workers linger. London is at i best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky glows a pale orange as Harvey and Kate walk and t along the South Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours is a beautiful city, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Harvey a moment, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its just a funny way of saying it. Quite old fashioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But i like it. (beat) Yours is glorious country, Honeychurch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks at Kate quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a line from a book. `Room with a View'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I'm not much of a reader. (beat) Too fidgety, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think less of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're just quite different, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks about it) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Kate's phone rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both our phones ring a lot. We have that in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to a stop as Kate takes out her phone and looks the handset display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I should probably take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum? (beat) I've been busy. (beat) No, I'm out. Yes with someone. No someone else. (beat) Yes. (looks at Harvey) ...a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey smiles. We hear Maggie's warble continue as Kate listens. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did, did you? (beat) An actual body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks at Kate. Kate shakes her head. Maggie contin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum. Listen. I'll come over tomorrow and we can check it out together. (beat) I have to go now. Just get an early night and i'll see you tomorrow. (beat) I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (beat) My mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She worries about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And herself. (beat) She's convinced she's living next to Poland's answer to Ted Bundy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start walking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She means well. She's just had a tough run. (long beat) My Father ran off to France with his secretary. Then mum got cancer, about four years ago now. She's fully recovered. But won't admit it. (beat) She's basically bored. And my continued `situation' as she calls it, being single, is her major distraction. Her pastime if you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my rotting eggs are her raison d'ГЄtre. (grimaces/turns to Harvey) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talk too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate comes to a stop and looks at Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. (beat) Well, here we are. My class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks up at a grey municipal building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long is the class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
