dialogues.text: Can I wait? (beat) Sorry - I promise I'm not `Bundyish'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) It's getting cold. You don't want to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling and backing towards the building) Careful, I might get the wrong impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, very tentatively, lifts her curtain again. No sig the `Killer'. Suddenly the doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maggie, slowly approaches the front door, the doorbell rings again. She slowly leans in and peers through the pe hole. POV: The Neighbour looms large. He holds in his arm large `something' wrapped in paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie pulls her head away. Beat. She looks again. POV: T Neighbour bends down out of sight and then rises again, turning to leave. Maggie watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slowly opens. Maggie looks around then notices t `thing' wrapped in paper on the ground. She quickly picks up and takes it inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As daylight fades, Harvey sits waiting. Through a large ground floor window, he watches Kate, as her class wraps As she comes out, he gets up and joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the usual. (beat) Lovely mild-mannered Mike read us the latest installment from his Physcho-Sexual Thriller, and we all tried to look at him in the same way after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we keep walking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate walk under Waterloo bridge past the secon hand bookstalls. A man plays a saxophone melancholically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever wish you could try a different life? (beat) Just for a day. Just to see what it would be like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would yours be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks down at her uniform) Well, no green, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat/thinks) It would take place in Spain. A little house inland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what would you do there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...I don't know... (beat) Write the great novel. (beat) I think I've got one inside me. We're not talking high art. Just a bloody good holiday read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. So this house in Spain would have a little cabana looking out over the plains for you to write in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a little stream running by, to bathe in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm there. (beat) Sorry, that's if you're receiving guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles, coming to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, you can visit Harvey Shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, thank you Kate Walker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a sort of Skiffle come Rockabilly busking act starts up. Two girls and a guy. They're great! Harvey and Kate stand amongst the crowd watching. The South Bank is its vibrant best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the sound of the Skiffle act still playing in the distant background, Harvey and Kate take a seat on some s over-looking the river. As darkness descends, street-lamp reflect off the water. They sit in silence. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened Harvey? (beat) Between you and your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Harvey shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (beat) Somewhere along the way I lost her. I lost my family. (beat) I just woke up one morning and realised i didn't belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd always had this mean little feeling in my stomach, that they were a bit embarrassed by me. (beat) If you saw them now, with Brian, Susan's step-father. You'd see, they make more sense. They look right together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Harvey looks out over the Thames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've not been a great father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Harvey's sad profile. Beat. She thinks for moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception. It's still going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch) I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grovesnor. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here? You must go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop feeling so sorry for yourself. She's your daughter, you're her father. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey shakes his head again. Kate is not about to give u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, it would be unforgivable not to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I'm thinking. (beat) Only if you come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, come with me. As my...bodyguard. (smiles) As my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate momentarily blushes, then shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, firstly, i'm not about to go to anyone's wedding in a green polyester work suit. Secondly it's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find you a dress. If we find you a dress, will you come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music/Montage: The song is the same as that played by the buskers. It's a fast, fun Rockabilly Skiffle thingy. We w as Harvey and Kate buy a dress. (Handheld/Double speed).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Taxi pulls up and out step Harvey and Kate. Kate looks fantastic on Harvey's arm as they walk up the front steps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reception is in full swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors close behind Harvey and Kate as they enter an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate stand side by side in silence. They both smile a little anxiously - almost like teenagers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a loud `ping' as the   elevator doors open onto hallway. Harvey and Kate step   forward. Down the hall, t some double doors we hear the   familiar din of a buzzing reception. Harvey momentarily   falters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate encourages Harvey forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open and Harvey and Kate enter. Heads turn. Jea looks up and sees Harvey with Kate. She shakes her head. Susan sees Harvey and gets up. She joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Susan's look, Harvey turns to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Kate. A... friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish) Hi. Congratulations. You look fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slightly awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry to gate-crash. Your father sort of insisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. I'm sure... (looks around) ...there's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan looks back at the full top table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get back. Don't worry about us, we'll find a place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (stops a passing waiter) Could you find them a seat please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete, acting as Master of Ceremonies, stands and clinks h glass for attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now for the best man's speech. Except we seem to be missing the bride. (laughter) Oh, no, here she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan heads back and resumes her seat at top table. The b man takes the mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott. What can I say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter leads Harvey and Kate to a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid this is the only place left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter shows them to a few empty seats at the childre table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate take their seats. The kids stare at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brace clad, large girl in a white frilly dress speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Uncle Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) You're not Miriam's kid are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...You've...got big. I mean grown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate feels someone's eyes on her and turns to her left to find a smartly dressed young boy of about eight, staring at her with his mouth open. Kate nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy remains silent, keeping his gormless gaze fixed o Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're not to dominate the conversation tonight. (turning back to Harvey) Chatterbox to my left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So without further ado, I'd like to propose a toast to Susan for making my friend Scott complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience whoop and clap. Scott gives his best man a h Pete stands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now ladies and Gentlemen. It is the turn of the Father of the Bride to say a few words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tonight that task will be carried out by the very charming and distinguished Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More clapping as Brian stands. Kate glances at Harvey, wh blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's quite some speech Josh. Quite something to follow. But I shall try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey suddenly stands and clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody really hears. He picks up his glass and a spoon an begins to tap it. People stir and turn to Harvey. Brian c to a stop. Jean looks on furious. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Brian... Sorry to interrupt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at Harvey. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you see I can't just sit hear and watch somebody else give my baby girl away. Susan's my daughter and I'm her father. Not the best, by far, but her father all the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter brings Harvey a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's arrival slightly throws him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... I should have prepared something but... I guess it reminds me of a joke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey continually knocks the mic against his chest, caus terrible feedback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Harvey drops the mic. Jean stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake Harvey, don't make a scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Harvey stares out at the party. They all stare b at him. He glances down at Kate who smiles back. Harvey l the microphone up off the table and raises it to his lips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Jean. I want to make a scene. You know. I'm tired of being embarrassed. (beat) If we can't make a scene on the day of our daughter's wedding, then when can we? I want to make a scene. I want to shout! I wanna tell the world how lucky it is to have our Suzie in it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna tell Scott, how damn lucky he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear, hear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People start to clap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) And also if he ever hurts her, I know people in north of London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously though. Scott, I swear you have found in Susan a bright and passionate person. And a loyal friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear, hear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can see from the way she looks at you. From the way she is with you, that she is... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...happy. (beat) And I thank you and welcome you to the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Scott share a look. The room applauds loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally, if I can linger a moment longer. I would like to turn it back over to Brian, with a note of... gratitude. (beat) Thank you for being there for my baby girl. Thank you for being there, when I wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Brian nods to Harvey, before standing and raising h glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you would all please join Harvey and I, in a toast. (beat) To Susan and Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan and Scott!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone claps loudly. Susan shares a gentle smile with h Father. Harvey sits and looks at Kate anxiously. Kate smi and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates to the rest of the table. Harvey turns to t now animated young neighbours, who all sit clapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, the first dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND strike up as Susan and Scott take to the dance floor. They dance a slow dance. Harvey and Kate sit watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a while Susan, looks over for her Father. Harvey hesitates, before Kate encourages him up. She plucks a fl from the table display and places it in his lapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey joins Susan and Scott on the dance-floor. Shaking Scott's hand, he leads Susan into a dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming back Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for having me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks on, as Harvey dances happily with his daughter Feeling something, she turns to find the eight year old's head slumped against her shoulder as he sleeps soundly. K smiles at her lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on the dance-floor, Harvey encourages Brian to take the dance with Susan. Harvey turns away and is joined by Uncle Fred and gang. They all chat animatedly. Uncle Fred pushes Harvey into a dance with his wife. A `Boogie' stri up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks on as Harvey dances and reunites with his exte family. She sees the delight in his face. She looks aroun all the happy faces. It's time perhaps to let the family celebrate alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extricating herself from the sleeping boy, she pushes two chairs together and makes a bed for him. Covering him in jacket, she glances back at the dance-floor before turnin leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on the dance-floor, a `Boogie' is in full swing. Har caught up in the fun, energetically swings Aunt Maddie around. He suddenly catches himself and turns to his tabl look for Kate, but finds it empty save for a row of dozin children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey makes his excuses and turns away, looking for Kate amongst the crowded room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate retrieves her coat and makes her way down the hall towards the bank of elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hurries to the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On turning into the hall, he sees Kate standing in the distance. Just then, she steps forward and out of sight. Harvey runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stands in the empty elevator, waiting for the doors close. She stares at her feet. Just then we hear a burst piano being played. It stops. Kate looks up to see, acros the hallway, in an empty conference room, Harvey seated a grand piano. He smiles a showman's smile before giving it another `old school' burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops again. Kate smiles. Just then the doors begin to close. Kate reaches forward and presses a button - openin them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey starts up again - but this time he plays something sincere - beautiful. Kate listens before slowly stepping of the elevator. She walks towards him, joining him at th piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey slides along the seat and indicates for Kate to jo him. She does so and listens as Harvey plays beautifully. He's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally brings the piece to an end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey smiles at Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are very kind. But...no. (beat) Shearing doing Rogers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. (beat) Well...you play it very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bows his head a little/with a smile) Well, thank you Ms. Walker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're most welcome, Mr Shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a little smile. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me thinks you were leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed I was, Sire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you looked happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks quizzically at Kate. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be with your family, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you know, maybe I want to be with you. (beat/sings) You make me happy - when skies are grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, Harvey. I'm blushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For making me come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a look, before both looking away. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a vacuum cleaner sounds. They both look up - as cleaning lady vacuums the floor nearby. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kid, they're playing our song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background we hear clapping and cheering coming fr the reception. A funky number starts up. Harvey takes Kat hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Come on. I want you to meet people. I want them to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey leads a slightly reluctant Kate back down the hall towards the reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band let rip on a funky tune. The congregation fill t dance-floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey leads Kate back into the room and heads straight f the dance-floor. As they pass relatives along the way, Ha introduces them to Kate. Much hugging and kissing ensues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate dance a boogie. Uncle Fred and Aunt Maddi join them. Uncle Fred steals Kate from Harvey and twirls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: Fun and Frolics on the dance-floor. Harvey is at center of it all. He initiates a Horah. A Congo line. Rus dancing! Kate's face says it all - she's having a ball. T sleeping kid, sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up on the M.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen. The bride and groom are about to leave. Please join me outside to send them off in style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate join the rest of the congregation outside the steps of the hotel. Harvey looks on as his daughter a son-in-law head to an awaiting car. Susan stops and throw the bouquet behind her. It is caught by Aunt Maddie, who turn throws it and it is caught by Harvey's `all grown up niece. She blushes profusely revealing an impressive set braces on her teenage teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan kisses her mother and Brian goodbye. And is about t get into the car when she stops and hurries over to Harve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye Suz... Bye Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him tightly. Pulling away she turns to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be gentle with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods as Susan turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles. As the car pulls away, everyone   cheers. Ha looks on. His eyes momentarily lock onto his   ex-wife's. share a conciliatory look. As Harvey watches   his daught car disappear down the street, Kate looks at   him. He tu back. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Harvey looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate walk. The streets are quiet. There is alr a hint of dawn in the sky. Rubbish trucks manoeuvre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn into the courtyard of Sommerset House and take seat on some chairs. The sky lightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I've stayed up all night since I was a student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare out over the courtyard. Silence. Harvey looks Kate for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got sad. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks back at Harvey and tries to read him. She look down at her lap, then up, out over the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. My uniform's green?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun begins to creep above the buildings. Harvey and K look out across the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was pregnant once. (beat) I didn't have it. Didn't give it a moment's thought. (beat) That's what smart girls did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do sometimes wonder what they'd be like today. (beat) Whether they'd be smart. Funny. Serious. (beat) I don't know, it's silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks at Kate in the morning light. Kate blushes a looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why i just told you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks away, then back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me here, tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly here, at these chairs. At noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles, determinedly trying to keep it light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your flight, Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to leave. (beat) Guess why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's blush deepens, she looks away and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate glances at Harvey, trying see the truth in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say that now, but wait until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today is tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey we know nothing about each other. You're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit older, yes. (beat) I can be mean. Really mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Truly cantankerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate can't help but smile. Beat. She glances towards the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) I should be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know enough to know, I'll be here. Waiting, at this chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Harvey, then again towards the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noon. I mean it. (beat) I'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles a little smile. She suddenly believes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey gets up and joins her. They look at each other. Ha suddenly leans in and kisses Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling away/can't help smiling) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey Shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have something until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate reaches for her purse and pulls out a photo. She giv it to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping backwards) I must go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and leaves, hurrying to catch a bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey stands holding an old library card. He looks down. it is a faded photo of toothy young girl, no older than eleven. Harvey looks up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate takes a seat on the top deck of a bus. Taking a mome to catch her breath, she looks out the window. Turning ba she allows herself a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, with a croissant lodged in his mouth and a cup of coffee in hand, buys a morning paper. He turns and crosse the road, skipping up the steps of his hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey enters, and waving to a slightly bemused concierge heads to the bank of elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid they're both out of order, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey glances at the sign, then over to the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess i'll walk, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, a man, seemingly impatient to start a `new life', runs up the steps. Surprised at first by his agility, he begins to slow. He stops to catch his breath. Suddenly hi spare hand holds tight onto the bannister. Unsteady Harve sits down. Close up on Harvey's face, confused. He tries stand but again is forced back down. He begins to place h coffee on the stair next to him, but suddenly shudders, grabbing his shoulder. The coffee topples, spilling down steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened and confused, Harvey sits alone in the stairwe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a door opens and the African porter from befor comes through, carrying a tray. He sees Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, are you Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks up in a daze, then shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, with a skip in her step, walks through the bustling day streets of London. She stops off and buys a bag of cherries from a `Fruit & Veg' vendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the porter and concierge talk to a medic, Harvey sits the back of an ambulance. The door is closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits waiting, expectantly, on the same chairs they h sat on earlier. She applies some lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey sits attached to various monitors and such, surrou by doctors and nurses. He looks agitated and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. I've got to be somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I need you to stay calm. It looks to me like Arrhythmia - an irregular heart-beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, S.V.T'S, that's what I've been trying to tell the nurse. I've had it since I was a kid. I take Primax. I guess i've been forgetting to take it recently. I've been under alot of stress, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Ok, then we probably know where we're at. But I need to check all possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As time passes, we watch as Kate's expression slowly turn from expectant to resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's Arrhythmia! Please, I have to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm 99% sure it is. But my job is to make sure it's not that 1%. I wouldn't be doing my job if I didn't check out absolutely everything. (beat) Nurse, we'll do an EKG, followed by Bloods. And can you arranfe a monitored bed for him for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As another pad is attached to his chest, Harvey looks bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks on as some kids play in the fountain nearby. S self-consciously smooths a fold in her skirt, then looks her watch. Beat. She looks down at the brown paper bag of cherries. Suddenly a resigned smile flashes across her fa she's been here before В­ nothing new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gets up and leaves. We watch her walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound of a vacuum cleaner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open on a close up of Kate's face - it says it all. Kate vacuums her mother's floor. She turns it off and unplugs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coiling up the cord, Kate puts the vacuum cleaner into a cupboard under the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Ok mum, that's me, I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie comes out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you stay and have some lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I've got to go. (beat) Not to pry or anything but why is there a large smoked ham under the stairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that, yes...It's, um...The neighbour gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The polish neighbour? (beat) So probably not a mass murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're going to be alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I will. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men, who needs them. Remember we've got Greece to look forward to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resigned, Kate hugs her mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate exits her mother's house and passes Paddy the Postma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking lovely as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey stands at a counter in a busy reception area. He h his phone lodged in the crook of his neck. In front of hi lies an open phone directory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some sort of Statistics Agency. (listens) Yes. That sounds right. Yes, based out at Heathrow. (listens) Thank you. Hold on. (turns to a receptionist) Miss, could I borrow, your pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist obliges as Harvey scribbles down a numbe an old envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, thanks alot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone rings behind the counter. Oonagh picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.N.S., Heathrow branch. (beat) Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Kate it's for you. Some guy called Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, stands nearby, holding a clipboard, about to head o onto the floor. She looks at Oonagh. She thinks for a bea then shakes her head, silently gesturing she not there. Oonagh, a little perplexed goes back on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I'm sorry. She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, phone to ear, thinks for a beat. He knows she's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oonagh pulls the phone away and gestures again to Kate. K shakes her head. Beat. Oonagh reluctantly lifts the phone her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, she's busy. (beat) She won't come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oonagh hangs up, looking at Kate. Kate shrugs defensively before turning to go. We hold on Kate's `confused' face a she walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, having hung up, lowers the phone from his ear. He looks around the room. Seated across the way an old man stares back at him. A receptionist arrives with some form

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could just get you to sign these, you'll be all done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey signs a form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there. (beat) And that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey glances at the receptionist - she is roughly Kate' age. Just then his phone rings. He picks up hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Harvey, it's Marvin. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns from the counter) Oh, I'm still in London, Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you get yourself back here my friend. I've got some great news. You were right. The Samuelson account. None of the kids could handle it. They couldn't nail it. They ended up picking one of your old tunes. They want you to come back and update it. (beat) We need you back, Harvey. Your old room's here waiting for you. (beat) Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey looks around the room at the lonely figures, waiti A young boy fidgets. Next to him sits a young man, lost i thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's great Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah, `it's great'. I mean, look, I know when to eat humble pie. So look, hey, when can you get back here? (beat) Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey glances back at the old man. The old man continues stare back. Beat. Something changes in Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I'm not coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm quitting Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean you quit? Harvey, fuck you man, you need us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you know, I don't. As you said, it's my `last chance'. (beat) Look, I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hangs up. A smile breaks across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey exits the Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heathrow please. As quick as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey gets in as the Taxi speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggie, manning the booth, attends to some passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Taxi pulls up. Harvey hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey approaches the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I'm looking for a Kate. Kate Walker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggie eyes Harvey, a little warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend. (beat) More than a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggie tuts and calls behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a man here looking for Kate, says he's `more than a friend.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than a friend?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oonagh comes out from the office, eyeing Harvey suspiciou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the American. (long beat) She likes you. I can tell. (beat) Now, don't you go messing her around. Don't you hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't. I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Oonagh continues to eye Harvey. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's left for the day. (beat) But you might find her at her class. (looks at her watch) I think it starts around now. Down on the Southbank. At the National.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you do, do you? (beat) Well, go on. Go get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey turns and hurries away. Oonagh and Aggie share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood oozes from his wound like dark chocolate on a warm summer's day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits listening in a daze, as `mild-mannered Mike' unleashes his latest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey alights from the Taxi, paying the driver. He runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone gathers their things as the class wraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey hurries towards the Southbank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate comes down from the upper terrace of the National, saying her good-byes to her classmates. In her hand she h a book. As she turns she sees Harvey coming to a stop in distance. She momentarily falters before approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still here - still in London...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) Kate, I just wanted to apologise and explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't have to - explain - it's fine -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I do -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to hear - it's fine, seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want to... (comes out) I had to go to Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God! Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's nothing, I'm fine, I just forgot to take my pills. I have this condition, I've had it since I was a kid - it's an irregular heart- beat sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrythmia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! How do you know what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling a little sheepish) My...My father has it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Well, young men get it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate can't help but smile. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, I'm so sorry I wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Kate takes a breath, and gives him the practical response she's gone over in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, I like you, I really do. And I had a lovely time - it was great. But, you know, I don't really do fountains at noon. (beat) I live in Willesden. And you live - in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White Plains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. And we're not teenagers, so - you know, monday morning and life kicks in, all that jobs and family and brown envelopes with bills in - it was a lovely day and I won't forget it, but it's not exactly real life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. It can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Harvey, it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, I want this. I want you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A button is pushed in Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not just about you, is it? (beat) You don't know anything about me. Look at me. It's pathetic. I expected you not to show for God's sake. I think I even wanted you not to be there, it's easier that way. (beat) You - you just dive in wherever, deep end, whoosh. But, I'm not your bloody swimming pool Harvey. (starting to break)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am not going to do it, I'm not going to do it because it will hurt. Not right now, maybe, but soon - there will be a "it's not quite working is it" or a "I need some space" or whatever it is and it'll end and it'll hurt and I won't do it, I won't and...I...Oh fuck, I don't want to cry. I don't want this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns and walks away, standing by the balustrade, looking down at the river below. Harvey watches. She take seat on a bench. Harvey gives her, her space. Then slowly approaches, leaning against a tree nearby. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's actually easier for me to be disappointed. I think I'm actually angry at you for trying to take that away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat. Just then Kate's phone rings. She reaches into bag and takes it out. She stares at the phone, thinking f beat, before answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Mum, I love you, but not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I take that as a hopeful sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you just give me a little wider smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling/laughing) Oh, shut up, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Kate collecting herself, looks up at Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's this going to work, Mr Shine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have absolutely no idea... (beat) But it will. (beat) I promise you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stares at Harvey for the longest while. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Harvey nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gathers up her things, stands and joins Harvey. They begin to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a short while Kate stops, puts her hand on Harvey's shoulder and takes off her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey glances down at Kate's feet, then up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're my kinda girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Kate smile. And as they walk away from us we h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask me those questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, from the airport. When I wouldn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the questionnaire. (beat) Ok. Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey Shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Place of residence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in transition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch as Harvey and Kate disappear into the sea of London...
